methods.name: open311.services.getList
methods.description: Returns a list of services for which incidents may be reported. The types of services and their meaning are left to the discretion of individual cities.

methods.name: open311.services.getInfo
methods.description: Returns basic information (as included in the _open311.services.getList_ method) as well any additional details that may be relevant to the service.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: A valid service_id to get information about.

methods.name: open311.incidents.getStatuses
methods.description: Return a list of valid statuses. The types of statuses and their meaning are left to the discretion of individual cities.

methods.name: open311.incidents.report
methods.description: Report an incident for a given service. Returns a unique ID for the incident that may be used to call the _open311.incidents.status_ API method.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: A valid service_id as defined by the city operating the Open 311 (Simple) API

parameters.name: notes
parameters.description: A free-form text field in which the user reporting the incident may leave additional notes.

parameters.name: photo
parameters.description: A photograph documenting the reported incident

notes: All dates should be passed in using the [W3C DateTime format](http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
All geographic data is expected to be using the [WGS84](http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/) projection.

methods.name: open311.incidents.getInfo

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the incident to get information about.

notes: All dates are recorded using the [W3C DateTime format](http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
All geographic data is returned using the [WGS84](http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/) projection.

methods.name: open311.incidents.search
methods.description: Returns a list of incidents matching a search criteria as defined by the API request.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the service type to search for. Multiple services may be passed in as a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the incident to search for. Multiple incidents may be passed in as a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: status_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of a status type to search for. Multiple statuses may be passed in as a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: The date or date range (see [api.md](https://github.com/straup/open311-simple/blob/master/api.md) for details) of when an incident was reported.

parameters.name: modified
parameters.description: The date or date range (see [api.md](https://github.com/straup/open311-simple/blob/master/api.md) for details) of when an incident was last modified.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: A geopgraphic location or extent (see [api.md]((https://github.com/straup/open311-simple/blob/master/api.md) for details) for details) in which to scope the query.

notes: All dates should be passed to the API (and returned in results) using the [W3C DateTime format](http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime).
All geographic data should be passed to the API using the [WGS84](http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/) projection.
If called with a valid OAuth token and signature then the query will be scoped to the user associated with that token.
Parameterless searches are not permitted. You must define at least one search criteria.
